title: Agriculture form 4management practices in rearing systeams lesson 12

tasks.task: Managing poultry in a pottery production setting.
subtasks: Explaining routine management practices (feeding, disease control, parasite management, egg collection, etc.)
Identifying good and poor layers through observation and methods like trap nesting
Evaluating physical traits of a good layer (com, eyes, temperament, etc.)
Checking space between keel and pelvic bone for proper egg-laying capacity
Determining color indicators for good layers (e.g., shanks color)
Understanding the process of debicking for egg-eating vices

tasks.task: Operating dust baths and warmers for parasite control
subtasks: Administering dusting and warmers to birds for parasite removal

tasks.task: Collecting eggs regularly to prevent vice behaviors
subtasks: Removing eggs from nest boxes to prevent egg eating
Addressing perpetual egg eaters and cannibals through debicking

tasks.task: Differentiating between good and poor layers for selective breeding or culling
subtasks: Observing beak color, ear condition, and other physical traits
Noting broodiness in hens and selecting non-broody layers

tasks.task: Maintaining hygiene in nesting areas (e.g., trap nesting method)
subtasks: Setting up and monitoring trap nests
Marking and recording laying hens for evaluation
Presenting lesson objectives and key concepts
Demonstrating methods to identify good and poor layers (visual, physical, etc.)
Discussing routine management practices in pottery production.
